channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: The best budget robot vacuums
item.description: Today’s robot vacuums are becoming a bit like cars: with all the features, upgrades, and fancy trimmings available these days, it’s easy to forget that they can just be simple machines that get us from point A to point B. Yes, some bots blow hot air on their bums (mop pads), deftly navigate dog poop, […]

item.title: ‘Marvel Rivals’ DPS Mains, Please Just Let Me Play That Nice Cajun Man
item.description: A humble plea from your strategist friends.

item.title: This superb turntable is so poised and revealing, but its hefty price and lack of a basic ingredient won't please everyone
item.description: The Technics SL-1300G turntable is the latest example of the premium brand delivering a premium product a decade into its second coming...

item.title: This ARM-based mini PC sports a full x16 PCIe slot for discrete GPUs - Minisforum says "desktop ARM" starts now, but can it live up to the hype?
item.description: Minisforum MS-R1 ARM mini PC offers discrete GPU support, expandable storage, UEFI boot, and 45 TOPS AI performance in compact form.

item.title: DHS Kept Chicago Police Records for Months in Violation of Domestic Espionage Rules
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security collected data on Chicago residents accused of gang ties to test if police files could feed an FBI watchlist. Months passed before anyone noticed it wasn’t deleted.

item.title: MSNBC is changing its name and embracing the ethos of a startup
item.description: Saturday is when MSNBC officially becomes MS NOW, standing for My Source for News, Opinion and the World. Asked what viewers should expect when television’s MSNBC makes its corporate divorce from NBC News final this weekend, network president Rebecca Kutler points to a poster on the wall of a conference room at its new offices off Times Square.

item.title: OpenAI Releases Its ‘More Conversational’ GPT-5.1
item.description: Get ready for 'quirky' mode.

item.title: Anthropic and Microsoft announce new AI data center projects in Texas, New York, and Georgia
item.description: The latest deals show that the tech industry is moving forward on huge spending to build energy-hungry AI infrastructure, despite concerns. Artificial intelligence company Anthropic announced a $50 billion investment in computing infrastructure on Wednesday that will include new data centers in Texas and New York.

item.title: New Nvidia DGX Spark competitor shows strong benchmark performance - and at half the price, could it be enough to convince some users to switch?
item.description: GMKtec EVO-X2 delivers AI workstation performance at half the cost of the DGX Spark.

item.title: Rian Johnson Had Fun Making an ‘Asshole Studio Cut’ of the New ‘Knives Out’
item.description: 'The Last Jedi' director also talked about a difficult editing sequence in his 'Star Wars' film.

item.title: You have spoken: iPhones are overrated… but not as much as you might think
item.description: iPhones get too much hype and are now overrated, according to TechRadar readers, but not as much as you might think.

item.title: Michael Caine and Matthew McConaughey are getting AI voice clones with ElevenLabs
item.description: Caine said in a statement that ElevenLabs is ‘using innovation not to replace humanity, but to celebrate it.’ Oscar-winning actors Michael Caine and Matthew McConaughey have made deals with voice-cloning company ElevenLabs that will allow its artificial intelligence technology to replicate their voices.

item.title: Flip the camera trend on TikTok: What is it and why are people upset?
item.description: TikTok's latest trend has some concerned.

item.title: During the government shutdown and SNAP pause, a lot more people turned to strangers to ask for loans
item.description: SoLo Funds, a community banking platform in which members fund loans for other members, has seen a surge in requests for loans from federal workers. For many Americans, 2025 has been tough economically. Tariffs have raised the price of goods (from coffee to clothing), inflation is still rising, and more than 1 million jobs have been cut since January....

item.title: A Proposed Federal THC Ban Would ‘Wipe Out’ Hemp Products That Get People High
item.description: The provision, tucked into the spending bill that could end the US government shutdown, would ban intoxicating hemp-derived THC products, including gummies and drinks.

item.title: Adult industry leaders like Pornhub form a coalition and release code of conduct
item.description: Pornhub and other studios formed the Adult Studio Alliance and released a safety standard for the adult industry.

item.title: The Cult of the Chatbot Is Rising
item.description: The church of the spiral.

item.title: The Steam Frame has two speakers on each side of your face for vibration cancellation
item.description: In its new Steam Frame VR headset, Valve put dual audio drivers on each side in the included head strap. That puts the audio near your ears while you’re wearing it, and in my brief time trying the device at Valve’s headquarters recently, I thought the sound was just fine. But the choice to have […]

item.title: The latest macOS dev beta can turn your MacBook screen into a workable ring light
item.description: New macOS dev beta introduces edge Light, a MacBook screen-based ring light for video calls.

item.title: By the numbers: How the government shutdown is impacting U.S. air travel
item.description: The FAA’s ultimate flight cut target is 10%, which is expected to take effect Friday. America’s aviation system is straining under the weight of the longest government shutdown on record: thousands of flight cancellations, long delays at major airports, and frustrated travelers nationwide.

item.title: Energy and tech news at UN climate negotiations in Brazil
item.description: The most high-stakes United Nations climate change conference in years is taking place this November in Belém, Brazil. It’s the 10th anniversary of the landmark Paris agreement, which committed nearly every country on Earth to working together to limit global warming. They’re off track, making this an important moment to show the world whether world […]...

item.title: The U.S. Mint just pressed its final penny
item.description: The last coin rolled off the Mint’s press this week, closing a long and sometimes controversial debate over whether the penny was worth keeping. A penny for your thoughts? Well, maybe try a nickel. Though it will remain legal tender, the last-ever one-cent coin was printed Wednesday—and not without some drama.

item.title: Sea Urchins Are Basically Brains Covered in Spikes, Study Finds
item.description: The pointy shell of sea urchins hides a remarkably complex neural network that resembles the brains of vertebrates, new research suggests.

item.title: Our Favorite Travel and Outdoor Gear Is on Sale at Huckberry
item.description: Huckberry’s eclectic curation of travel clothing, coffee gear, and backpacks are all on sale right now.

item.title: America’s Last Penny Is Being Minted Today
item.description: The rapid-fire process of killing the penny is already causing some disruption.

item.title: Waymo to start taking freeway rides in select cities
item.description: Riders in San Francisco, Phoenix, and Los Angeles will soon be able to take freeway rides.
